Quote: If I know what love is, it is because of you.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: Wise men make more opportunities than they find.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quote: Never say there is nothing beautiful in the world anymore. There is always something to make you wonder in the shape of a tree, the trembling of a leaf.
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quote: Nothing strengthens authority so much as silence.
Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Quote: Nothing is softer or more flexible than water, yet nothing can resist it.
Author: Laozi

Quote: The way we communicate with others and with ourselves ultimately determines the quality of our lives.
Author: Tony Robbins

Quote: Friendship is Love without his wings!
Author: Lord Byron

Quote: In friendship as well as love, ignorance very often contributes more to our happiness than knowledge.
Author: François de La Rochefoucauld

Quote: It is no use saying, 'We are doing our best.' You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: Your friend is your needs answered.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: In wisdom gathered over time I have found that every experience is a form of exploration.
Author: Ansel Adams

Quote: All our talents increase in the using, and every faculty, both good and bad, strengthen by exercise.
Author: Anne Brontë

Quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quote: I'd rather regret the things that I have done than the things that I have not done.
Author: Lucille Ball

Quote: Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of the imagination.
Author: John Dewey

Quote: The Superior Man is aware of Righteousness, the inferior man is aware of advantage.
Author: Confucius

Quote: Think as a wise man but communicate in the language of the people.
Author: William Butler Yeats

Quote: A little knowledge that acts is worth infinitely more than much knowledge that is idle.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: There is no scarcity of opportunity to make a living at what you love; there's only scarcity of resolve to make it happen.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: They must often change, who would be constant in happiness or wisdom.
Author: Confucius

Quote: We live in a society bloated with data yet starved for wisdom. We're connected 24/7, yet anxiety, fear, depression and loneliness are at an all-time high. We must course-correct.
Author: Elizabeth Kapu'uwailani Lindsey

Quote: If one is lucky, a solitary fantasy can totally transform one million realities.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.
Author: Chuck Swindoll

Quote: Applause is a receipt, not a bill.
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: It all depends on how we look at things, and not how they are in themselves.
Author: Carl Jung

Quote: Eternal nothingness is fine if you happen to be dressed for it.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.
Author: Rumi

Quote: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece, make friendship a fine art, drink deeply from good books - especially the Bible, build a shelter against a rainy day, give thanks for your blessings and pray for guidance every day.
Author: John Wooden

Quote: Remember that a gesture of friendship, no matter how small, is always appreciated.
Author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

Quote: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential... these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.
Author: Confucius

Quote: Don't worry about people stealing your ideas. If your ideas are any good, you'll have to ram them down people's throats.
Author: Howard H. Aiken

Quote: The only way to prove that you're a good sport is to lose.
Author: Ernie Banks

Quote: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: Be as you wish to seem.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Don't ruin the present with the ruined past.
Author: Ellen Gilchrist

Quote: If you do what you've always done, you'll get what you've always gotten.
Author: Tony Robbins

Quote: Friendship with oneself is all important because without it one cannot be friends with anybody else in the world.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: They blame those who remain silent, they blame those who speak much, they blame those who speak in moderation. There is none in the world who is not blamed.
Author: The Buddha

Quote: Friendship is a very taxing and arduous form of leisure activity.
Author: Mortimer J. Adler

Quote: Meditation brings wisdom, lack of meditation leaves ignorance. Know well what leads you forward and what holds you back and choose the path that leads to wisdom.
Author: The Buddha

Quote: We make our own fortunes and we call them fate.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
Author: Isocrates

Quote: The winner ain't the one with the fastest car it's the one who refuses to lose.
Author: Dale Earnhardt

Quote: Technology has to be invented or adopted.
Author: Jared Diamond

Quote: You teach best what you most need to learn.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: I cannot even imagine where I would be today were it not for that handful of friends who have given me a heart full of joy. Let's face it, friends make life a lot more fun.
Author: Chuck Swindoll

Quote: An invasion of armies can be resisted, but not an idea whose time has come.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
Author: Laozi

Quote: Wisdom is a kind of knowledge. It is knowledge of the nature, career, and consequences of human values.
Author: Sidney Hook

Quote: He who angers you conquers you.
Author: Elizabeth Kenny

Quote: Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: As you think, so shall you become.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: A really great talent finds its happiness in execution.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: Friendship is the marriage of the soul, and this marriage is liable to divorce.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: To free us from the expectations of others, to give us back to ourselves... there lies the great, singular power of self-respect.
Author: Joan Didion

Quote: I'll prepare and someday my chance will come.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Nothing could be worse than the fear that one had given up too soon and left one unexpended effort that might have saved the world.
Author: Jane Addams

Quote: Appreciation can make a day, even change a life. Your willingness to put it into words is all that is necessary.
Author: Margaret Cousins

Quote: If one is estranged from oneself, then one is estranged from others too. If one is out of touch with oneself, then one cannot touch others.
Author: Anne Lindbergh

Quote: No day in which you learn something is a complete loss.
Author: David Eddings

Quote: You learn to speak by speaking, to study by studying, to run by running, to work by working; in just the same way, you learn to love by loving.
Author: Anatole France

Quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: There is never enough time to do everything, but there is always enough time to do the most important thing.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.
Author: Elbert Hubbard

Quote: They must often change, who would be constant in happiness or wisdom.
Author: Confucius

Quote: The doors of wisdom are never shut.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: The way we communicate with others and with ourselves ultimately determines the quality of our lives.
Author: Tony Robbins

Quote: Learning is finding out what you already know.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: Many sophisticated, intelligent people lack wisdom and common sense.
Author: Joyce Meyer

Quote: Tennis is a perfect combination of violent action taking place in an atmosphere of total tranquillity.
Author: Billie Jean King

Quote: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: If there is such a thing as a good marriage, it is because it resembles friendship rather than love.
Author: Michel de Montaigne

Quote: The key to transforming our hearts and minds is to have an understanding of how our thoughts and emotions work.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Never complain and never explain.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: Everything that exists is in a manner the seed of that which will be.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.
Author: Carl Jung

Quote: If you're trying to create a company, it's like baking a cake. You have to have all the ingredients in the right proportion.
Author: Elon Musk

Quote: Friends are those rare people who ask how we are and then wait to hear the answer.
Author: Ed Cunningham

Quote: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
Author: Laozi

Quote: By believing passionately in something that does not yet exist, we create it.
Author: Nikos Kazantzakis

Quote: All know the way; few actually walk it.
Author: Bodhidharma

Quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Author: Isocrates

Quote: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
Author: Seneca the Younger

Quote: The most precious gift we can offer anyone is our attention. When mindfulness embraces those we love, they will bloom like flowers.
Author: Thích Nhất Hạnh

Quote: Stay away from what might have been and look at what will be.
Author: Marsha Petrie Sue

Quote: If a man does not make new acquaintances as he advances through life, he will soon find himself left alone. A man, sir, should keep his friendship in a constant repair.
Author: Samuel Johnson

Quote: The man who trusts men will make fewer mistakes than he who distrusts them.
Author: Camillo Benso, Count of Cavour

Quote: The greatest obstacle to connecting with our joy is resentment.
Author: Pema Chödrön

Quote: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: It is not enough to have a good mind; the main thing is to use it well.
Author: René Descartes

Quote: Your sacred space is where you can find yourself again and again.
Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: God made me fast. And when I run, I feel His pleasure.
Author: Eric Liddell

Quote: By living deeply in the present moment we can understand the past better and we can prepare for a better future.
Author: Thích Nhất Hạnh

Quote: If you talk to a man in a language he understands, that goes to his head. If you talk to him in his language, that goes to his heart.
Author: Nelson Mandela

Quote: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.
Author: William Butler Yeats

Quote: Beauty is a pattern that our minds recognize, but don't fully understand.
Author: Me
